intro: Eriogonum alatum var. macdougalii, commonly known as the MacDougal’s spiny flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its spiny, glandular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. This variety is part of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is known for its resilience in arid environments.
